intro: Dendrobium aberrans var. nanum, commonly known as the miniature dendrobium, is a compact orchid species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its short, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant is epiphytic, growing on trees or rocks, and thrives in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), adapting to its natural habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ease of cultivation, it is a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
